newsitem.title: USA: U.S. MUNICIPAL FOCUS - ends day 1/4 point lower.
newsitem.headline: U.S. MUNICIPAL FOCUS - ends day 1/4 point lower.

text.p: U.S. municipal bond prices lost about 1/4 point overall Wednesday, moving lower with Treasuries but again performing with less volatility than the government market.
The Treasury long bond was off 16/32 at 95-27/32 heading into the New York close, to yield 6.83 percent.
"There is cash selling in our market but it isn't overwhelming," one municipal trader said. Most of the downturn came in the afternoon, with the market virtually unchanged in morning action.
Traders continued to cite extremely low new issue volume and a lack of significant economic data this week as factors keeping a lid on activity.

March municipal bond futures ended 19/32 lower at 114-17/32, while the March U.S. Treasury bond futures contract slipped 15/32 to 111-1/32. The MOB spread was 112 ticks, compared to 116 ticks at the close on Tuesday.
Actively traded issues in the secondary market included Delaware River Port Authority FGIC 5-1/2s of 2026, which were bid at a 5.67 percent net yield, down three basis points.
Houston water and sewer FGIC 5-3/8s of 2027 were unchanged at 5.79 percent net.
In competitive action, Lehman Brothers won $150 million Port Authority of New York and New Jersey AMT bonds, reoffering the 2014 maturity 5.65 percent.
Prudential Securities Inc won a second $150 million port offering, which was not subject to the AMT.
